jbt.execution.context
Class HierarchicalContext

java.lang.Object
  jbt.execution.context.BasicContext
      jbt.execution.context.HierarchicalContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
IContext
public class HierarchicalContext
extends BasicContext

A HierarchicalContext is a context that stores a parent IContext to fall back to when it cannot find a particular variable in its own set of variables. This class just redefines the method getVariable(String) so that if the variable name cannot be found, its value is retrieved from the parent context.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

Field Detail

parent

private IContext parent
The parent context. When a variable cannot be retrieved from the current context, it will be looked up in the parent context.

Constructor Detail

HierarchicalContext

public HierarchicalContext()
Default constructor. Builds an empty HierarchicalContext, with no parent context.

Method Detail

setParent

public void setParent(IContext parent)
Sets the parent context of this HierarchicalContext. May be null, in which case no parent context will be used.

Parameters:
parent - the parent context, which may be null.

getVariable

public java.lang.Object getVariable(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value of a variable whose name is name. If a variable with such a name cannot be found in the current context, and there is a parent context set, the variable will be looked up in the parent context, and its value returned. If it cannot be found in the parent context (or in any other parent contexts through recursion), null is returned.

Specified by:
getVariable in interface IContext
Overrides:
getVariable in class BasicContext
Parameters:
name - the name of the variable to retrieve.
Returns:
the value of a variable whose name is name, or null if it does not exist.
See Also:
es.ucm.bt.context.BasicContext#getVariable(java.lang.String)
